p: Parameters for the baseline HAART scenario appear in Table 1. HAART decreases the transmission rate and thus reduces the incidence of new HIV cases. However it also increases the lifespan of HIV+ individuals, such that the net impact of HAART is a small net increase in the number of HIV+ individuals in the population ( Fig. 3a). Significant reductions in the number of HIV+ individuals in the 15–39 year old age range due to reduced incidence are offset by significant increases in the number of HIV+ individuals in the 40+ age range due to longer lifespans and delayed age at infection ( Fig. 3d). As a result of reduced transmission rates, the number of HIV− individuals grows considerably, causing a decrease in overall HIV prevalence ( Fig. 3a,f).
